messages.content: When I was first elected in 1998, I was Manchester’s youngest Councillor. My commitment to you and our area is as strong now as it was then, nearly twenty years ago. I have been proud to represent you on the Council and in Parliament, and I want to do so again. Our area needs an MP who will spend their time sticking up for South Manchester and not infighting with their party; I believe you deserve to know what kind of person you’re supporting if you back me—that’s why I’m submitting my CV to you. Labour are failing to get the basics right, like road repairs, housing, health services, and crime. The choice could not be clearer: a Labour win will mean more of the same—they are too divided to fight for Manchester, they’re too divided to fight for you, and they’re too divided to stand up to the Government over a hard Brexit—leaving us with fewer jobs, rising prices and higher rents & mortgages. As the sole opposition Councillor, I stand up for our area. If I am your Member of Parliament, I will tirelessly stick up for you. There’s a lot at stake in this election. This is your chance to make a difference. I hope you’ll see that I have the passion, determination and experience to be your effective voice in Parliament. On Brexit, on education and on NHS funding, you deserve an MP who is on your side.

issues.brexitEurope: too divided to stand up to the Government over a hard Brexit

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Manchester Withington
